result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher M. Craig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).
  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).
  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions: 

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any counseling or education programs ordered by the agent.

Pay costs. 

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete a class on domestic violence (24- or 26-week program), as well as a class on parenting.

Seek employment as recommended by the agent.

May have contact with the children as permitted by Richland County HHS.

No contact with Janean Craig unless permitted by the agent.

DNA sample to be provided and DNA surcharges to be paid.

In the event of revocation, Defendant will have 3 days credit and be eligible for huber/work release.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher M. Craig

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Christopher M. Craig
Current: 18337 Gillingham Drive, Richland Center, WI 53581 United States  (Effective: 01-29-2015)
Prior: 18801 STH 60, Muscoda, WI 53573 United States

14CF24, 14CF51, and 14CF52.  ADA Forehand, Def in custody, and Atty. Lawrence for 14CF24 and 14CF51 and Atty. Longacre for 14CF52.  

Counsel have informed the Court that the parties have reached an agreement to resolve all three cases.

ADA Forehand details the agreement:  Def to plead to all three charges in 14CF24, to one amended count of mis. bail jumping in 14CF51, and to stalking charge in 14CF52; all other counts to be dismissed/read in.  Per Forehand, the sentencing recommendation calls for 3 years probation in 14CF24 with conditions to include costs, d.a. education, completion of parenting class, seek/maintain employment as agent deems appropriate, contact with the children as allowed by HHS, and no contact with JC.  In 14CF51, recommendation is for 6 mo jail.  In 14CF52, recommendation is for 18 mo in/2 yr ext. supervision imposed/stayed for 3 years probation.

Def pleads no contest to the counts stated.  Court's colloquy re pleas.  Finding of guilty.

Parties address Court.  Defense requests stay of jail (Atty. L makes the request).  Court denies the stay.

Sentence:  

14CF24 - 3 years probation with conditions that def attend, succ. complete, and pay for any counseling/education programs; pay costs; attend/pay for/succ. complete class on d.violence (24-26 week class); parenting class; seek employment as recommended by agent.  May have contact with children as permitted by Richland County HHS.  No contact with JC unless it is permitted by agent.  3 days credit.

Work release granted.

14CF51 - 6 mo county jail with huber, to begin immediately.

14CF52 - 42 month Wisconsin prison system sentence with Dodge as reception center - 18 mo initial and 24 mo ext. supervision.  This imposed and stayed for probation of 3 years, concurrent with other 3 year probation term with same conditions described in 14CF24.  If revoked and on ext. supervision, he would have same conditions.

Court provides felony conviction admonishments.

DNA sample and surcharge.

D.A. enhancer to be added to the stalking count costs.
Status conference on September 17, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Court directs clerk to set this matter for 09/17/14 status conference. Moved from 10/15/14.

ADDRESS INFO for Christopher M. Craig
Current: 18801 STH 60, Muscoda, WI 53573 United States  (Effective: 08-26-2014)
Prior: 18801 State Hwy 60, Muscoda, WI 53573
Status conference on October 15, 2014 at 09:00 am.

ADA Forehand, Def, and Atty. Lawrence for initial in 14CF51 and status in 14CF24.  

Formal reading waived in 14CF51.  Def also waives time limits for prelim.  Status requested and set in both cases.

Atty. L states that bond was modified at the last hearing; wants it modified further; states the the def and party are presently engaged in counseling; asks that bond be amended to allow the parties to have contact for that counseling.  ADA Forehand is opposed to that request.  Court denies Atty. L's request to further modify bond.  Status conference scheduled for 10-15-2014 at 09:00 am.
Amending Bond

Defendant may have contact with his minor children, CLC, MEC, KJC as directed by Health & Human Services. All remaining bond conditions not amended by the preceding language shall remain in effect. No contact with JC is lifted.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 20, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Peter K Lawrence in court with Defendant Christopher M. Craig. Prosecuting Atty Amy E Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty L gives status of case, parties are working toward resolution, requests matter be setover for plea/sentencing. Request for bond amendment. Dept. does not object to removing no contact with JC, requests also contact with children provision be amended to " contact with children as directed  by Health & Human Services". So ordered.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 20, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's ...
Status conference on June 30, 2014 at 09:00 am.

ADA Forehand, Def, and Atty. Lawrence.  Atty. L states that the def wishes to waive his right to prelim.  Prelim waivers presented to the court.  Court's colloquy re waiver of prelim.  State files information.  To the charges in the information, Atty. Lawrence waives formal reading.  Def stands mute for entry of NG pleas.  Atty. L requests status scheduling with status to serve as date for potential plea/sentencing.  Court sets status (possible plea/sentencing) for June 30th at 9.  Status conference scheduled for 06-30-2014 at 09:00 am.
of C Dilley/CSW from Richland County HHS

Defendant may have contact with his minor children CLC, with dob 2/26/02, MEC with dob 9/3/2000, and KJC with dob1/24/05, as permitted by the Richland County DHHS.  In addition to the telephonic contact Defendant is permitted to have with his wife, Janean Craig, Defendant may have face-to-face contact with his wife during professional counseling sessions sanctioned by the Department.  All remaining bond conditions not amended by the preceding language shall remain in effect.
re bond
Status conference on May 21, 2014 at 10:00 am.

ADA Forehand, Def, and Atty. Lawrence.  This is Atty. L's first appearance.  Court stated the charges at an earlier hearing and informed Def of his rights.  Atty. L informs the court that the def wishes to waive the time limits for a prelim; not waiving prelim rights at this time.  Atty. L states he will be filing a discovery demand; requests status scheduling.  Status conference scheduled for 05-21-2014 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 23, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Christopher M. Craig in court. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Forehand states that the Def has indicated he plans to be represented by Atty. Lawrence but Atty. L could not be here today.  Def informs the Court that he wishes to waive formal reading of the complaint.  Court states the charges and informs def of the possible max. penalties.  Def confirms that he does plan to hire Atty. Lawrence.  Next date will be adjourned initial.

Def asks the judge if the no contact can be lifted with his wife.  ADA Forehand states that he has concerns re that request; believes it's too early in the proceedings to allow for that; believes bond conditions are appropriate as presently set.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 23, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
written minutes
Additional condition: Def. may have contact with JC when released from jail for the purpose of transporting her home.
